question: my friend has had diabetes her entire life.  she wears a pump.  sorry dont know what kind of diabetes.  she has a pinched nerve c5-6 and is wondering what procedure would be more successful, laminectomy or fusion.  her doc said fusion but didnt tell her the part about the graft.  she is about early 40s and has been in continuall pain for over a year.  has had multiple mis diagnoses such as carpal tunnel, and shoulder impingement in which both cases resulted in surgery (for naught).  i told her a year ago she had a pinched nerve but the docs kept missing it.  she is depressed and just wants the pain to end and resume her life wiht her family, working in yard is her goal.  the diabetes makes her sick frequently.  please give success rates for both procedures.  i say laminectomy due to she can always have a fusion later if it doesnt work and no graft so less chance of non union at fusion site bu of course i am not a doctor only a PTA.  what do you suggest?
title: cerv. fusion vs. laminectomy, diabetes
